https://justjoin.it//offers/exadel-polan.description:
We are seeking a Middle DevOps Engineer passionate about building tools and services as a force multiplier. If you are passionate about innovative tooling, engineering an excellent user experience, and increasing large-scale efficiency, let's meet and discuss our perspectives.Work at Exadel - Who We Are:Since 1998, Exadel has been engineering its products and custom software for clients of all sizes. Headquartered in Walnut Creek, California, Exadel has 2,800+ employees in development centers across America, Europe, and Asia. Our people drive Exadel’s success and are at the core of our values.Project Team:When you join our team, you'll be immersed in a culture where teammates always help each other achieve better results. We believe that together we are greater and that we can find brilliant solutions by sharing ideas.About Our Customer:The leading provider of vehicle lifecycle solutions, with headquarters in Chicago, enables the companies that build, insure, and replace vehicles to power the next generation of transportation. Its platform delivers advanced mobile, artificial intelligence, and car technologies. It connects a network of 350+ insurance companies, 24,000+ repair facilities, hundreds of parts suppliers, and dozens of third-party data and service providers. The customer's collective solutions enhance productivity and help clients deliver better experiences for end consumers.About Our Project:Safekeep is a business unit that focuses on automating insurance claim subrogation for auto, workers compensation, property, and general liability claims.Project Teams: (4 Scrum teams)2 Teams of full-stack engineers focused on Claimflo (core subrogation workflow app)1 Team of data engineers focused on ingestion pipelines and integration with carriers (3 data engineers based in the US)1 Team of data scientists focused on building a subrogation opportunity detection model.Requirements:
3+ years of background as a technical specialist
1+ year of proficiency in programming in languages such as Python (preferred), or Javascript, or similar object-oriented language
1+ year of competency working with AWS in a production environment
Familiarity with AWS services such as IAM, AWS Lambda/API Gateway, EC2, ECS
Expertise in automating cloud-native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure
Grounding in Infrastructure as Code, using CloudFormation, Terraform, or other tools
Skills developing cloud-native CI/CD workflows and tools, such as GitLab and/or Jenkins, Bamboo, TeamCity, Code Deploy (AWS)
Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture, such as containers, serverless technology and/or Kubernetes
Overlap with US hours (CST) 3-4 hours/till 7pm CET
Communication skills sufficient for success in a remote and largely asynchronous work environment
Demonstrated capacity to clearly and concisely communicate about complex technical, architectural, and/or organizational problems and propose thorough iterative solution
English level:Intermediate+ Nice to Have:
Bachelor's Degree or 3+ years of professional experience
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing, and firewall
Know-how in monitoring and log aggregating frameworks such as Datadog, Kafka, Logstash, Splunk, Elasticsearch, and Kibana
Familiarity with AWS services such as Amazon SageMaker, AWS Glue, EMR, MSK
Awareness of implementing and designing cloud-native security concepts, DevSecOps, or MLOps
Knowledge of iOS and/or Android app operations and deployment
Familiarity with the full software development lifecycle and delivery using Agile practices
Confidence in Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments
Responsibilities:
Design, build, and administer development operations processes, and tools including version control, security scanning services, CI/CD pipelines, release engineering, and production deployments of core platform components
Troubleshoot, diagnose and fix production software issues, develop monitoring solutions; perform software maintenance and configuration; implement the fixes for internally developed code; query SQ /NoSQL data stores to identify and remediate production issues related to infrastructure (network, storage, compute, and databases) and application operations
Collaboration in design and build of internal tools to support development and operations including an internal dashboard, performance testing automation, infrastructure, and cost optimization in the cloud
Work alongside Software Engineers supporting operations, ensuring the team delivers the best experiences for our customers
Advantages of Working with Exadel:Transparent Career Roadmap
The HR manager accompanies each employee on their first steps in the company and assists them in achieving future professional goals
Exadel is a global company with 30+ offices in 15+ countries. Employees have the chance to discover new places to live and work, and can transfer to any location that has an Exadel production office. The HR manager and the Global Mobility specialist accompany the employee and assist throughout the relocation process
Your career growth is in your hands, so each Exadeller decides when to level up and initiate performance assessments. The management team supports career planning and the discovery of new tech stacks and languages
Learning & Development Opportunities
Each Exadeller is given a $1,000 yearly budget for self-education, which includes certifications, training sessions, meetups, conferences, and educational materials
Employees participate actively and benefit from the knowledge-sharing environment across seven practice units: Digital Marketing Technologies, Content Marketing, AI, QA, QAA, Agile, and DevOps
Employees can find recordings from meetups and trainings on Exadel’s Internal Learning System
Work & Life Balance
Each Exadeller is in charge of managing their workflow independently without being micromanaged at every step; it is, however, important that an employee always attends meetings, logs their time, and meets deadlines
Operating from the office, or remotely, depends on which mode the employee prefers. Hybrid or remote mode staff will receive the necessary equipment before their first working day. For those who prefer to work in-office, the office network offers up-to-date equipment, good facilities, and a warm collaborative environment
The team meets at two annual team-building events across locations; in addition there are team events such as Pizza Days, Programmer’s Day, informal meetups, board game parties, and sports initiatives
Employee Perks & Bonuses
The Exadel referral program covers all regions and involves recognition for hired recommended professionals. Depending on the location and the position, an employee receives a monetary bonus for recommending a candidate to Exadel who ends up being hired
Employees collect coins for numerous project activities, exchanging them for products or services of their choice available on the Exadel store
Volunteers for mentoring, interviewing, performing assessments, and participation in community meet-ups, get additional monetary bonuses
Location-dependent, Exadellers can access benefit platforms with vouchers for online stores, medical insurance reimbursement, sports membership fees, vacations, and childbirth bonuses.

https://justjoin.it//offers/aviva-asec-d.description:
Hi, we're glad you're here! We are hiring to our Aviva Services Excellence Centre! Take a look at our job description - maybe it suits you or one of your friends?What will you be doing?
Responsible for deploying, automating, maintaining, troubleshooting and improving the systems that keep the backend infrastructure running smoothly,
Ensuring the security, performance, monitoring and design integrity of data and the underlying infrastructure,
Building close working relationships with Business customers as well as internal and external service providers to ensure continuity of Business and application service,
Contributing to the shaping of technical standards and guidelines whilst ensuring a consistent Cloud DevOps approach is applied across the various BI Tools used within the area,
Troubleshooting deployment incidents if they happen,
Being a mentor and coach in the use and adoption of Cloud and Business Intelligence technologies,
Providing input to inform the shaping of new projects and initiatives, assessing the impact of initiatives or projects on systems/applications,
Be a bridge between the operations and Cloud teams,
Undertaking design and code reviews to ensure systems meet functional and non functional requirements and proactively identifying where changes are required to maintain these in the future,
Take an active part in vulnerability management and disaster recovery to protect Aviva systems.
What we’re looking for?
Experience of working as DevOps or Software Engineer,
Around 2 years of experience for the Junior position,
2-4 years of experience for the Mid position,
5+ years of experience for the Senior position,
AWS operational experience,
Have knowledge about most of the mentioned tools and programming languages: HCL (Packer, Terraform), Jenkins (DSL), Bitbucket or GIT, Jira, Confluence, Powershell, Bash, SQL, Python,
Extensive understanding of concepts like CI/CD, configuration management, cloud platforms, version control, automation, monitoring, analytics,
Microsoft Azure DevOps tools operational experience,
Experience of Windows Server technologies – e.g. Active Directory, DNS, File services, Windows 2016 and Windows 2019,
Experience with Windows Server and Linux troubleshooting,
Knowledge of Postgres or MSSQL databases,
Ability to effectively communicate with team members,
Desire to learn new technologies, automate and continuously improve existing standards and frameworks,
At least basic understanding of DevOps culture.
Nice to have:
Agile experience 
Network troubleshooting knowledge,
Experience working in serverless environments (EKS),
Experience working with AWS file storage technologies e.g. FsX, File Gateway, EFS,
Experience of working in a zero trust security environment.
In Aviva Services Excellence Centre, we provide: 
Contract of employment 
Performance Bonus 
Private medical care (ENEL-MED) 
Emotional support consultations 
Cafeteria system of benefits (e.g. MultiSport card) 
Additional parent privileges: 
- baby leave – 6 weeks leave for second parent 
- shortened working time after parental leave 
Employer-funded group insurance 
Employee Shares Plan 
Extra day off for birthday 
Paid time off to volunteer 
Additional leave acquired over the years in the company (even 5 days more in a year) 
Wellbeing Leave - additional two weeks paid leave after 10 years of service 
Access to the e-learning platforms 
Internal employee referral program 
Possibility to work remotely 
Attractive office location in Warsaw - Gdański Business Center 
Additional entitlements for people with disabilities - Work Without Barriers 
Work environment that promotes diversity - Diversity Charter 
Do you see yourself in Aviva Services Excellence Centre? Be sure to apply!  Aviva is for everyone!  As a signatory to the Diversity Charter, Aviva applies a policy of equal treatment and creates a work environment that is friendly to people with disabilities. We do not require from candidates the date of birth, marital status and attached photos to your CV. We encourage all individuals regardless of gender to apply. Most of our people are smart working – spending also time in our office - combining the benefits of flexibility, with time together with colleagues. We’re inclusive - we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Excited but not sure you tick every box? Research tells us that women, particularly, feel this way. So, regardless of gender, why not apply and try! To find out more about current job offers at Aviva take a look here.

https://justjoin.it//offers/backbase-dev.description: The Job in shortWork in our development team and embrace the DevOps role to bring excellence to our software engineering teams. In this role, you will be part of our Developer Enablement department, identifying ways to ensure that our CI/CD processes are stable and mature, as well as supporting and coaching teams across the wider product development organisation. In this role, you will be our developers’ go-to DevOps person.   What you’ll doBackbase uses a scaled Agile product organization and we expect everyone to develop their personal leadership skills continually which ensures quick feedback cycles with our stakeholders.● Automating everything is our aim and CI/CD is our game. As a DevOps Engineer, you play a key role in bringing together software development and IT operations in the delivery of our banking product. As a member of the tribe, you work closely with all disciplines such as Java software developers, Frontend software developers, QA Engineers, Technical Writers and Product Owners to ensure the entire software development life cycle of our omnichannel banking portal product;● Contributing to the quality and delivery of our software products. Your work has a direct impact on the ability to continually innovate our products and improve our way of working;How about you● You are flexible, balanced, always striving for improvements;● You have previously worked with containerisation (Docker) and orchestration (k8s) and have experience with Helm Charts;● You have bash/shell and scripting programming experience, Linux/Unix experience;● You have designed and/or delivered mission-critical services (preferably cloud-based services);● As a plus, you have worked with IaC methodology before, and have some Terraform knowledge;● You have used configuration management tools such as Spring Cloud Config and build tools such as Maven;● You love efficiency and find smart ways to automate tasks for you and your team;● You have experience deploying to application servers such as Tomcat or Websphere in enterprise environments, and working with relational databases.

Digital & Technology Team (D&T) is an integral division of HEINEKEN Global Shared Services Center. We are committed to making Heineken the most connected brewery. That includes digitalizing and integrating our processes, ensuring best-in-class technology, and embedding a data-driven culture. By joining us you will work in one of the most dynamic and innovative teams and have a direct impact on building the future of Heineken! Would you like to meet the Team, see our office and much more? taking care of administrative tasks related to the operation of the Heineken RPA platform (UiPath), such as Windows server maintenance, business application installation, network connectivity and database administration

proactively communicating and collaborating with external/internal stakeholders to implement the requirements for the platform
actively participating in the selection of new technologies, executing proof of values, implement new features of the platform
ensuring the overall HEINEKEN standards and best practices are adhered by (e.g. Quality, Security, Compliance)
participating in all the team Agile ceremonies: daily Scrum meeting, Sprint Review, Sprint Planning, Sprint Refinement, and Sprint Retrospective.

Bachelor/Master’s degree, preferably in technical field
proven track record in corporate IT administration (3+ years)
experience as Windows Server administrator (application installation, Active Directory management, log tracing, network troubleshooting)

willingness to explore the root cause of any type of issue (like server(s) being down, RDP access missing, application versions not matching), and to solve ASAP
the basic understanding of SQL server administration
good understanding on RPA and/or UiPath, or an excellent motivation to learn it fast
experience of working in a deadline driven environment with rapid release cycles
excellent facilitation, presentation, and analysing skills
good understanding and hands on experience with DevOps Ways of Working, and CI/CD in particular.
 You are a perfect match if you also have:Experience with Azure Cloud, Git, Power Automate and Power BI.What we offer:🏠 Flexible Work from Home scheme💸 Attractive Performance Bonus🚗 Parking Space for Employees⏰ Flexible working hours💳 Sodexo Card☂ Life Insurance➕ Employee Referral Programme🌐 Job Opportunities within HEINEKEN🩺 Private Medical Healthcare⭐ Social Events

English proficiency, both written and spoken.

doświadczenie w pracy z Dockerem.• Znajomość systemów kontroli wersji, preferowany GIT• Podstawowa znajomość języka T-SQL• Podstawowa znajomość ActiveDirectory• Podstawowa znajomość systemów kolejkowych, preferowany RabbitMQ• Podstawowa znajomość języków C#,HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, XPath, yaml• Angielski na poziomie min B2/C1Mile widziane:• Znajomość narzędzi do orkiestracji Dockera, takich jak Kubernetes, Docker Swarm lub podobnych.• Podstawowa znajomość systemu Linux i jego administracji.• Podstawowa znajomość HAProxy.Co oferujemy:• Wybór formy pracy – na miejscu/ hybrydowo/zdalnie • Dodatek za pracę zdalną• Elastyczne godziny pracy i komfortowe miejsce do pracy • Niekorporacyjną atmosferę • Stabilność projektu (praca w długoletnim projekcie, bardzo dobra współpraca z klientem)• Mentoring i wsparcie doświadczonych kolegów• Dostęp do najnowszych rozwiązań technologicznych• Indywidualną ścieżkę szkoleniową • Refundację egzaminów MS• Dostęp do platform szkoleniowych• Pakiet kompleksowy LuxMed• Dofinansowanie karty Multisport • Udział w ciekawych imprezach firmowych • Biuro w centrum Gdańska Wrzeszcza

We are looking for Senior Azure DevOps Engineer / SRE for our global client (FMCG industry).Qualifications:
Experience in each of the following areas:
Knowledge of system administration concepts and networking protocols. Familiarity with operating systems, virtualization, and network fundamentals.
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure cloud platform, services, and deployment models. Experience with Azure Resource Manager (ARM), Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, and Azure Networking.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Azure Resource Manager Templates, Terraform, or Azure Bicep to provision and manage Azure infrastructure.
Familiarity with DevOps principles and tools like Azure DevOps, Git, CI/CD pipelines, Docker and configuration management systems (e.g., Ansible, Chef, Puppet) for automated deployments and infrastructure management.
Knowledge of Azure Monitor, Azure Application Insights, and log management systems for effective monitoring and observability. Understanding of metrics, logging, and distributed tracing.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Understanding strengths and weaknesses of Azure PaaS services (experience in big / complex deployments).
Fluent English (written and spoken).
Responsibilities:
Ensure system availability and reliability.
Respond to incidents promptly and identify root causes.
Optimize system performance and scalability.
Automate operational tasks and develop tools for efficiency.
Establish robust monitoring and alerting systems.
Collaborate on capacity planning for future needs.
Conduct post-incident reviews and propose improvements.
Foster cross-team collaboration between development and operations.
Drive continuous improvement of systems and processes.
